snippet: The attack in Paris could have far-reaching implications for the future of the eurozone and for companies doing business there.
abstract: Andrew Ross Sorkin DealBook column asserts stock market typically rebounds quickly in wake of terrorist attack, but reaction may belie actual cost of terrorism; says financial and political costs continue to rise.
lead_paragraph: The attack in Paris could have far-reaching implications for the future of the eurozone and for companies doing business there.

headline.print_headline: Fallout From Attacks Is Measured in More Than Stock Markets
